column4: anyone aware of problems withe the nvidia driver?  Installed ubuntu like a month ago and beryl worked great easily, now whenever is goto install nvidia driver i get stuck at 800x600?
tried "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" to set your res?
- yep, didnt do anything, just reinstalled , again! (3rd time, faster than fixing)
huh, tried adding the resolutions manually editing the xorg.conf file?

try the reconfigure command again, and only choose the highest resolution you want. You might also want to check the xorg.conf file in the Device section to see if the Driver is "nvidia" not "nv" or "vesa"
u know it works fine until i install the nvidia drivers...
do the drivers say anything weird? or just plain install without errors?
no Beryl but.. it works, nope just plain install no probs, what strange is this was all working fine and easy before
what version did you had before, and what's your card?
getting tired of reinstalling it all, i mean its quick but id like to just get it running again.. =(
fawn, 6800gt
try installing an older nvidia driver to see if that helps
like d/l from nvidia site?
and... are you using the nvidia official driver or just the ubuntu ones through the restricted manager o.O?
yeah, those are the ones that work
just checked the box, worked before
in restricted driver
try removing that (I dunno how, never used it) and install the nvidia official driver
where would i manually edit the config - if you will
which file?
/etc/X11/xorg.conf
edit it with sudo
ty
er, sudo nano, or gksudo gedit
